result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Karl Probst Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the period of extended supervision. Any remaining balance at the end of extended supervision will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

*Restitution is set at $0 (zero)*

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
No contact with Pick & Save at 7780 S. Lovers Lane Road and Walmart at 4140 W. Greenfield Avenue.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING of Original Transcript (29 pages) commencing 05-04-2015, by JENNIFER L. CARTER.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received, signed, and filed with the court.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jean Kies, Br. 45, calendar successor, for review. mag

Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  


AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 365 days and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 365 days with the following conditions:


AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons concurrent to count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 365 days and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 365 days with the following conditions:

     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Pick & Save at 7780 S. Lovers Lane Road and
          Walmart at 4140 W. Greenfield Avenue.
     *   No firearms; weapons.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge)
           during the period extended supervision.
          Any remaining balance at the end of extended supervision 
          will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

Defendant Scott Karl Probst in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Scott Karl Probst in custody. Student intern Derek Waterstreet under the student practice rule supervised by Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Scott Karl Probst not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save or Walmart.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Scott Karl Probst in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Scott Karl Probst in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
